Definition: Buah cheri refers to the fruit of the tree also known as the "Malayan cherry" or "Singapore cherry" (scientific name: Eugenia uniflora). The fruit is small, round, and about the size of a cherry, with a bright red or orange skin (when ripe) that is mildly tart or sour in taste. Note: The word "buah" means "fruit" in Malay, while "cheri" is a transliteration of the English word "cherry."
